Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.sparse

Class SparseVector

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.sparse.SparseVector
Direct Known Subclasses:
SparseVectorHuge
public class SparseVector extends Object
Compressed Sparse Vector object that represents a single row (if created from CSR) or column (if created from CSC) of the sparse matrix. The row or column from which it was created is stored in the internal attribute vectorIndex. The length of the vector is stored in the internal attribute vectorLength. The value and index (column or row for CSR or CSC, respectively) can be returned for the jth entry in the vector from the methods getValue(j) and getIndex(j). If the backing arrays from a CSR or CSC represented SparseMatrix are destroyed then the arrays defined here may no longer be valid.

    • SparseVector

    • SparseVector

      public SparseVector​(ArrayListInt ptrsX, ArrayListInt x, ArrayListDouble v, int k)
      Standard constructor.
      Parameters:
      ptrsX - The compressed row (CSR) or column (CSC) list for which the kth entry will be selected to populate this compressed sparse vector.
      x - The sorted column (CSR) or row (CSC) list that will supply the requested indices from the getIndex(j) method.
      v - The sorted value list that will supply the requested values from the getValue(j) method.
      k - The row (CSR) or column (CSC) index represented by this compressed sparse vector.

      Returns:

    • findIndex

      public int findIndex​(int i)
      Performs a binary search to locate the input key i within the index array. This method assumes the SparseVector has been sorted. The outcome is undefined if the SparseVector is not sorted. If the input key is not contained in the SparseVector then its insertion point is returned. The actual index should be checked by validating that getIndex(findIndex(int i)) == i.
      Parameters:
      i - The index searched for in the index array of this SparseVector.
      Returns:
      The index containin i, or its insertion point where i would be inserted.

    • normalizeIndex

      public void normalizeIndex​(double[] aNorm)
      Normalizes each value in aValue by the column entry in aColNorm whose column is selected using the entry in aIndex.
      Parameters:
      aColNorm - The column normalization array.

    • normalize

      public void normalize​(double aNorm)
      Normalizes each value in aValue by the column entry in aColNorm whose column is selected using the entry in aIndex.
      Parameters:
      aColNorm - The column normalization array.

    • scale

      public void scale​(double scl)
      Scales all elements in the value array for this CSV.
      Parameters:
      scl - The value by which each element is scaled.

    • sumOfSquaresPartial

      public double sumOfSquaresPartial​(int maxVecIndex)
      Returns the sum-of-squares of all elements in the value array whose index is less than the input maximum maxVecIndex.
      Parameters:
      maxVecIndex - The maximum index value for which elements whose index equals or exceeds this value are not included in the result.
      Returns:
      The sum-of-squares of all elements in the value array whose index is less than the input maximum maxVecIndex.

    • update

      public double update​(double val, double[] vec)
      Performs a double precision update of this sparse vector with the input vector vec. The results are summed to the input value (val) and returned on completion.
      Parameters:
      val - The initial value of the returned result.
      vec - The vector that will multiply this sparse vector. This vector is addressed only at locations defined in indxArray.
      Returns:
      The final vector product val += sum(valsArray[i] * vec[indxArray[i]]; i = 0; i < vectorLength);

    • update

      public void update​(double[] val, double[] vhi, double[] vlo)
      Peforms a DoubleDouble precision update of this sparse vector with the input vector v(hi,lo). The results are summed to the input value (val(hi,lo)) and returned on completion.
      Parameters:
      val - The initial value of the returned result (hi,lo).
      vhi - The DoubleDouble high component of the vector that will multiply this sparse vector. This vector is addressed only at locations defined in aIndex.
      vlo - The DoubleDouble low component of the vector that will multiply this sparse vector. This vector is addressed only at locations defined in aIndex.

    • getMaxIndex

      public int getMaxIndex()
      Returns the maximum index in the index arrays (sorted so last position).
      Returns:
      The maximum index in the index arrays (sorted so last position).

    • getMinIndex

      public int getMinIndex()
      Returns the minimum index in the index arrays (sorted so first position).
      Returns:
      The minimum index in the index arrays (sorted so first position).
